Understate: The claim may understate the extent of the damage caused by Hurricane Hanna to the border wall between the United States and Mexico.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no concrete evidence or official confirmation that Hurricane Hanna knocked over part of the border wall.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video showing the border wall being knocked over is related to Hurricane Hanna, when in fact it was from a different incident in New Mexico.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the video, as it was confirmed by the US Army Corps of Engineers that it was unrelated to Hurricane Hanna and was caused by high winds in New Mexico.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statement from US Customs and Border Protection (CBP), which said they were not aware of any border wall panels falling over due to Hurricane Hanna.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of Hurricane Hanna on the border wall, as there is no evidence to support the claim that it was knocked down by the storm.
